/upp [<extra-dice>]

Generate a set of six characteristics. If extra dice are specified, then extra pairs of dice are rolled, and the highest six pairs will be used to generate the UPP.

The results can be dragged to an actor's characteristics to set them.

/damage <hits> [--noui] [traits…]

Do the specified amount of damage to the token.

If —noui is specified, then characteristic damage will be applied automatically rather than bringing up a dialog.

Trailing options can be used to set weapon traits, such as stun or AP.

/status <status…>

Set a status effect on selected actors.

A number of macros are provided by default, to make it easier to perform some actions directly from the hotbar.

These macros can also be embedded in Journal entries if you want.

All macros use the following structure:

[[/command <macroName> <arg1=value1> <arg2=value2>]]{Flavour Text}}

Embedded Macros

Embedding a macro into a journal entry can be done using the following command string in a Journal entry:

[[/command <macroName> <arg1=value1> <arg2=value2>]]{Flavour Text}}

The command for running standard macros is /mgMacro

A number of macros are provided by default, to make it easier to perform some actions directly from the hotbar, or just to provide some examples.

It is also possible to embed these macros in a description for an actor or item.

See the MgT2e Base Macros compendium pack for these examples.

A macro must be in the macro folder for it to be callable in this way.

INternal Macros

Internal macros are like embedded macros, but their implementations are hard coded into the core system, so they cannot be changed. This means that they are always available, and perform some more complex actions.

These use the /mgt2e command.

Skill Gain

/mgt2e skillGain skill=pilot.smallcraft level={level} context=<text>

e.g.:

[[/mgt2e skillGain skill=pilot.smallcraft level=0 context="Service skill"]]

A character token must be selected when this macro is executed, otherwise an error will be given.

The skill consists of a skill id, plus an optional speciality id.

If level is not provided, then the skill will be improved by 1 level, up to a maximum of 4. If a level is given, then the skill will be raised to the given level, but no higher.

Skill Check

In order to make a skill check,

/mgt2e skillCheck skill=admin

Optional arguments:

  • target - Target difficulty of the skill check

  • text - Text to display whent the skill is rolled.

  • success - Text to display if the skill check is a success.

  • failure - Text to display if the skill check is failed.
